case_vignette: A 1-year-old male presents with intermittent history of itchy spots on the palms and soles that flare and then resolve over the past 6 months. Mother is unable to identify any clear inciting trigger. She has tried over the counter hydrocortisone but lesions remain. An in office mineral oil preparation is negative for any microorganisms. Physical examination reveals vesiculopustules over the palms, soles, and ankles.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have itchy spots on my palms and soles that come and go.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for the past 6 months.
Do the spots have a particular color or texture?
The spots have developed into small blisters and some have pus.
Have you noticed any patterns or triggers that cause the spots to appear or worsen?
No, I haven't been able to identify any clear triggers that cause the spots to appear or worsen.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you currently on any medications?
No, I don't have any existing medical conditions and I'm not on any medications.
Is there any family history of skin diseases or similar symptoms?
There is no family history of skin diseases or similar symptoms mentioned.
Have you experienced any fever, joint pain, or other systemic symptoms along with these spots?
No, I haven't experienced any fever, joint pain, or other systemic symptoms along with these spots.
Final Diagnosis: Dyshidrotic eczema
